alert.note: Alert for Early; Miller (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 23 at 5:22AM EDT until May 23 at 5:45AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northwestern Miller County in southwestern Georgia... Central Early County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 545 AM EDT. * At 521 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 10 miles northwest of Donalsonville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Miller and central Early Counties, including the following locations... Cuba, Killarney, Damascus, Howards Mill, Early Co A/p, Old Damascus, Mayhaw, Hentown and Centerville. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
